title: Easy Asian Soup
directions: Bring stock to a boil. While water is boiling, chop ginger and onions or leeks and wash greens.
Turn heat down to medium and add Bragg, Tamari or Coconut Aminos, ginger and green onion or leeks.
While it is simmering, break or cut up noodles (I do this inside a plastic bag or paper bag to prevent the little noodles from flying all over the kitchen).

Add noodles. Simmer for another two minutes or so while chopping bok choy. Unless using baby bok choy (which you can cook intact), remove the leaves from the white stems and set aside. Chop the stems into 1/2" pieces and place into the pot
ingredients: 6 c veggie or beef stock OR 6c water and 1 Tbsp MSG-free broth powder or 1 bouillon cube
1 Tbsp + 1tsp gluten free Bragg, Tamari Sauce or Coconut Aminos (Coconut Aminos are soy free)
1 Tbsp chopped green onion or leeks
2 c bean thread or rice vermicelli noodles, broken or cut with kitchen shears into small pieces about 1‚Äù long (I used bean thread noodles for the soup in these photos)
2 c chopped bok choy (whites and leaves separated)
